website_summaries.verdict: Good value, as you'll receive 3 battery operated water leak detection sensors for 1 price.
pros: Designed to operate in non-controlled temperature conditions, so you can employ these sensors almost anywhere
Sensor can be placed within 6 feet of base unit
Uses one 9-volt battery per sensor that's included, enhancing the value you'll receive
cons: No low-battery alarm available, so you must test it regularly

customer_reviews.title: Works well but not the best design
customer_reviews.text: These work well provided they will not tip over. The piece on the bottom is what detects the water and while it is detachable, if kept in tact with the rest of the unit, it needs to be standing upright. For instance, we had one placed under our sink and luckily I noticed that it had been tipped over before we had a leak, but in general it is not a very good design. It does work though. Our main drain backed up and one of these little guys started going off as soon as the water started to back up onto the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Bird

customer_reviews.title: Worked after two to three years
customer_reviews.text: I put this in my attic Air Conditioner system to warn me of leaks. I actually forgot about it for two or three years until I heard the alarm go off one day recently. When I went into the attic I did see water dripping into a pan and ended up call the HVAC people. This alarm saved me from some much more costly and aggravating repairs that I would have to do to the ceiling. I am most amazed that the battery lasted so long. You are supposed to change it after a year and this lasted somewhere from two to three years. I'm amazed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little alarm for peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I have smoke/co2 alarms from FirstAlert and adding this for additional peace of mind. Seem to be good quality product. Pop in the battery and it is good to go. It should be placed vertical up, as the sensor/end-points are at the bottom. Double sided tape should keep it from fliping over on its belly or back which will defeat its purpose. FirstAlert can think of providing a double sided tape instead of screws. Near sump-pump and other locations I pulled the extension cord out and put the sensor ends to the floor/surface with a wooden block on top so it stays in place. I placed the alarm itself on a shelf.
customer_reviews.author: kschrishna

customer_reviews.title: I NO LONGER WORRY ABOUT ANOTHER BASEMANT FLOOD
customer_reviews.text: Can't say anything about the long run, but after having a flood in my basement that went unnoticed for a few days and thousands of dollars in clean up costs, I wanted to make sure I knew immediately about any leaks. I have put them near the things that might leak and tested them by putting them on a small spillage on the floor. They went off immediately and loud enough to be heard in the house. I then wiped the bottom with a dry cloth, which silenced them quickly. I now have peace of mind. I would recommend this for anyone who has a basement to do this.
customer_reviews.author: my thoughts

customer_reviews.title: Every home should have these
customer_reviews.text: I placed these behind the washing machine, dishwasher, fridge, and in every room with a sink and toilet and in the attic under the A/C drip pan. Twice they have alerted when the dishwasher overflowed. They are great to have and not expensive, especially compared to cleaning up water damage.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Feel better having these in the basement.
customer_reviews.text: I am involved with a local museum, we had a minor flood when the water heater had a leak. We dodged a major bullet as it could have been much worse, none of the collections were damaged. While we do not anticipate any problems as we had to replace the water heater. I do feel better having these in the basement as there are times when no one goes downstairs for several days at a time especially during the off season. Tested them to see how sensitive and how loud - they will be heard up on the main floor and are very sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: m.l.m.

customer_reviews.title: Money saver
customer_reviews.text: Installed 3 of these after I had my condensate line plug causing a considerable water leak in the house. Since doing so my sink began leaking without knowing and this alerted me of it and saved me no idea how much more water damage. Well worth the money. Very loud!
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Siren will wake the neighbors!
customer_reviews.text: The air/heat radiators are prone to leaking in my 62+year condo. The drip pans overflow and have ruined carpets & tile floors. Shortly after installation (battery needs installation & takes a special screw driver). there was a leak and my neighbor called before I could dry the sensor so they definately work.
customer_reviews.author: Merle L. Holman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to work with. One of the low reviewers didn't understand how they were designed. The bottom sensor comes off with a cable. This way you can mount the sensor a little higher while the probes sit on the floor. I use them under air exchange units in a condo (for when AC condensation builds up). These can catch condensation problems before damages begin. The only flaw I see, is that I can't daisy chain the probes together. Our blower units are about 4 feet wide with 2 drip pans. I'd like to put probes in 3 locations. If I could buy a sensor and purchase leapfrog probes, than this product would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy L. Boulden

customer_reviews.title: JUST SIT THEM ON THE FLOOR
customer_reviews.text: I have three places in my basement most likely to spring a leak and with the First Alert WA100-3 3-Pack Water Alarm I covered all my bases by unboxing the alarms, installing the supplied name brand batteries, and then sitting them on the concrete floor under every potential leak site. It doesn't get easier than that, and they are plenty loud enough to be heard throughout the entire house!
customer_reviews.author: Terri Carrozza

customer_reviews.title: terrible product.  Do not recommend. Used in floods
customer_reviews.text: Update. Here is a factual review. As I live in Florida and we just had horrible flooding. So first hand factual review. Terrible product. I set up all three in areas. First alarm isn't loud enough to hear even in a small home. And if you buying this to alerted to rain coming near your door. Terrible product and did not work. Very disappointed. When I did hear it it kept going off with no water near it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Use these with wifi cameras to remotely alert me to water leaks using sound
customer_reviews.text: I got these to place under my second home water heater, washer, etc. I have a wifi-based home monitoring system I designed and build myself, but adding wifi-based water sensors everywhere I might need them seemed too expensive. I already have two wifi cameras that also sense sound and will alert me when they hear loud noises, so I plan to monitor water leaks by listening for the loud noise made by these units. Seems a simple solution.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Zouck

customer_reviews.title: Tested and detects small amounts of water quickly
customer_reviews.text: This one works by making an electronic connection between the contacts, your fingers will set it off. I tested with small drops of water on a concrete floor and it alarmed loudly. I put one in a bucket I have under my gas water heater drain so any drops of water will set it off. No actual leaks to report on.
customer_reviews.author: Jedifender

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I put one of these in my basement where I had had some water issues in the past. Twice it went off with false alarms and I had to venture to the cellar to pull the battery to get it to shut off. Think of it as a defective smoke alarm located in a difficult place that goes off for no reason. I had given one to a family member and called them and told them they may not want to set theirs up. Disappointed in this product but not worth my time to collect them all and return.
customer_reviews.author: storyboy

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a leak to test these out in an emergency situation. However, I did test them with a tiny amount of water on the counter top and they worked fast and loud. You need to have one of these anywhere there is a chance for a water leak. I suggest changing the batteries yearly and test them just to be sure they are still working.
customer_reviews.author: htb

customer_reviews.title: Great investment. Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely work! I had a small water leak under my kitchen sink. Just a few drops of water set it off. The alarm was loud enough to wake me up in the middle of the night. It took me a few minutes to realize it was the water alarms. & not the smoke detectors. These are a good investment to avoid costly insurance claims!
customer_reviews.author: Chinese Crested's mom

customer_reviews.title: Cheep insurance
customer_reviews.text: These have saved me thousands in damage from my renters. If you have rentals this is a must! I use these in 10 homes I own and put then next to every washing machine, dishwasher and sink. At least one goes off every year because of a water leak caused by the renter. They always call me because these alarms are so loud and they cant figure out how to shut them off.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Good but....
customer_reviews.text: I've had them for more than 3 years now. + Battery life is over a year. I changed batteries only once, but you all know this depends also on battery quality. + Loud enough to be heard. Although a bit difficult to find the source of the alert because of the high pitch. + Detects water instantly. No false alarms either. - When flooded to about half the height of the device it dies (2.5" of water). I think this kind of device should be water proof. I'll try to open it up and clean the circuits.
customer_reviews.author: ip74

customer_reviews.title: Can save thousands in repair costs due to water Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I buy these for my customers because if you live in a 2 storey house, a water leak can cause thousands of dollars in damage and serious disruption to everyday life. I live in a single storey house and have no personal experience. First Alert is generally trustworthy, and the price is unbeatable.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Lerner

customer_reviews.title: Simply works as stated
customer_reviews.text: We put these in place and they worked. In the first instance, we heard the alarm go off in the garage and found that the water heater had a tiny leak. Called plumber, leak fixed, end of story. In the second instance, we came home one afternoon to the sound of alarms blaring and water pouring out of our front door. A water pipe had burst while we were gone, so no one heard the alarm. Almost the entire house was under several inches of water. The alarms kept working, even though they were quite wet. One happy ending and one unhappy ending, but the alarms worked as advertised both times.
customer_reviews.author: Calsummer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect product for homeowners and landlords.
customer_reviews.text: Very interesting product. Anyone who's ever had a bad water-heater or a water leak in the basement would appricate the piece of mind this product offers. Even a little watter will set off a loud alarm which keeps sounding until the contacts are no longer wet. This model is reuseable, which makes it better than many conpetitors. I use this in my rental property basement. Under the sinks, in the basement and behind the toilet. Anyplace water can leak and cause structural damage to my properties. I very good cheap insurance policy for homeowners and landlords.
customer_reviews.author: Lt. Jim Flip  Ret.

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective and it works!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 6 for the house. All tested and worked and put off a sound that is loud enough for you to know something is wrong. Simple, affordable and it just works! Have a piece of mind and potentially save you thousands in water damage. I just feel better knowing if something happens, I will be alerted.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Kim

customer_reviews.title: All 6 batteries for these units were dead on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 6 of these units for multiple places around my home. When I received them I immediately tested them to confirm they would function. All 6 worked, but immediately had a problem. The innitial alarm tone started strong and then immediiately began to fail. In testing the batteries they come with, all 6 were very close to dead. Note: when comparing product and price you will likely need to buy new batteries for these units!
customer_reviews.author: DJ Pallett

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: Saved me when my basement started to flood from a backed-up sewer. The bottom comes off and has a 6 ft wire to the sensor so you can place it on the floor, while the unit is elevated. Highly recommend this product. Use it in my rentals, as well. You will definitely hear the alarm, that is for sure! Worth every dime.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Cheap peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: These are invaluable for anyone who knows what its like to find water in the basement due to any of the various reasons (washing machine issue, water heater issue, sump pumps issues etc). These are plug and play- put the battery in and place the unit where you want to watch for water- the sensors are on the bottom of the unit- loud alarm.
customer_reviews.author: LG19Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these after hearing someone have a sump pump stop working and flood the basement. I placed one near the washer, water heater, and sump pump. I tested each with a bowl of water and it was loud sound similar to smoke detector. They have not gone off since. I guess the downside is to check once a year or remember to change batteries. For the cost I think it is nice to have for just in case. Of course if you are not home not much you can. I turn off the water to the house before going on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: LShupex

customer_reviews.title: Saved the Day!
customer_reviews.text: These things have saved the day more than once. My hot water heater just decided to destroy itself today and started leaking all over my basement. Fortunately this alarm alerted me instantaneously and saved me a lot of trouble in carpet/floor damage.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Well-made alarm. Easily tested once the battery is installed by placing a moistened finger across the two sensor contacts. Liked the idea of the sensor having the capability of being remotely located (up to 6 feet). Used one under our kitchen sink and liked it so well (quality, ease of installation, location of alarm & battery replacement, and alarm loudness) that we purchased others to be installed under bathroom sinks, in the laundry area, and at the H2O heater overflow pan. Excellent product! Unable to review battery life at this time but assume that the frequency is annual as with all battery-powered alarms.
customer_reviews.author: regenero

customer_reviews.title: These are great for loud alarm if they get wet
customer_reviews.text: Have these near the water heater, sump pump and softener. I have had water issues in basement in past and get nervous when it rains a lot and worry about the sump still working. These are great for loud alarm if they get wet. have the unit zip tied to the sump eject pole and the cord zipped down to the floor and the contacts sitting on floor just outside the crock. Have the others near their respected units.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeShopper

customer_reviews.title: We like these, and they are sensitive
customer_reviews.text: We like these, and they are sensitive, and the sensor has an option to either leave it in the unit, or pull it out up to about 5 feet, and place the sensor on the ground, and the main unit can be mounted to a wall or such.
customer_reviews.author: RUOK

customer_reviews.title: I tested it for the water and it alerted with pretty high volume
customer_reviews.text: After I had my water heater broke down and we have water in the area, I decided to give this a try. As per the instructions, I tested it for the water and it alerted with pretty high volume. So now I have it under the sink and by the washer. it comes with the battery too and 5 years warranty. so can't beat the price for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Sonal Shah

customer_reviews.title: My plumber recommended a water alarm to replace the pan in case ...
customer_reviews.text: Just had to replace a pan I had under my old washing machine because the new washer/dryer didn't allow for the space the pan took up. My plumber recommended a water alarm to replace the pan in case water should be present the First Alert alarm will sound allowing me to prevent a water 'event.' Very easy to put together and the package comes with three alarms to be placed near the washer and near my water heater.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Borges

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: So far these have failed to go off each time they have gotten wet.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa H. Luther

customer_reviews.title: Great water leak alarm pack!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome and small, I placed one by my hot water tank in my basement, another under my kitchen sink and another under the bathroom sink. The loud sound will alert you if any water leaks and touches the devices bottom sensors. Could have used this when my hot water tank burst and was leaking non stop, over night, flooding my basement. Good thing the tank was close to the drain. After I received these alarms I set them down and one stormy day my basement cement wall had a crack and it leaked, sounding the alarm. I was then able to grab a mop and move important things out of the way of the floor drain. Good to have.
customer_reviews.author: KittyFox

customer_reviews.title: Worked 4 Years Later
customer_reviews.text: I am amending my review from 4 stars to 5 stars. I purchased these in 2014. I honestly had forgotten about them, as none had ever gone off. I just figured they really did not work. But today, in 2018, 4 years later, the one started blaring! I could hear the alarm 2 stories away. I discovered the washing machine discharge had over flowed a small very amount, and the detector's alarmed was triggered. I have never changed batteries or anything. I was really impressed. First review in 2014-Received these quickly, and they worked when we tested them. I haven't tried them since putting in the basement several months ago, but we also haven't had any leaks either.
customer_reviews.author: GH

customer_reviews.title: Work!
customer_reviews.text: Never had water in the basement of a house but just moved in to a newer house and thought why not get some? I did and just a few days later, the pump float fell off the sump pump and water backed up in to the basement. Alarm worked perfect. Alerted to the problem and was able to fix the float and get the pump going with minimal water over flow.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: A small price to pay for peace of mind.  And it works!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these a few years ago. This morning I awoke to the sound of the one under my kitchen sink. A leak! Sure works great. My only issue is that I can't remove the battery without unscrewing the whole back (it was very noisy until I could remove the battery and stop the alarm. Usually it just turns off after you remove it from the water but the unit itself was soaked. Update, another one alerted me last night to my washing machine spewing water all over. Thank G-D for this!
customer_reviews.author: Suki

customer_reviews.title: Rally good product !!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought them in 2012. Now 06/30/2019 all three of them still work with original batteries and they saved my under sink cabinets in bathroom and kitchen number or times. I have room for two more of them so I'm buying another set.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Gives me peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Our basement flooded and we were lucky we caught it early before more damage was done. With these alarms placed around the basement I have peace of mind knowing if it happens again, we'll be even more ahead of damage!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Works Well and LOUD
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I especially like the detachable part with the sensor and they include enough wire to make it worth while. Worked on one occasion when we were reworking some water lines. We had forgot about the sensor and it took little water to set off the alarm. And yes, extremely loud!!! But that is what we want in an alarm!! Will be getting more to use in other areas.
customer_reviews.author: Mart

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: May not wake me up in the middle of the night but they work perfectly for my purposes. I especially like how the sensor can be placed far enough away from the alarm.
customer_reviews.author: schlabow

customer_reviews.title: Saved us from a serious mess.
customer_reviews.text: Just like any alarm, you hope to never have to hear it go off but you're glad you have it when it does. I placed this behind the wall in our basement bathroom by the macerator pump for our up-flush toilet. One of the hose clamps on the pump was not on tight enough and came off. This alarm went off from a small trickle of water before anyone used the toilet and flushed raw sewage behind our new basement walls. You just need to remember to change the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Strong

customer_reviews.title: sensitive to moisture and very well made
customer_reviews.text: i originally purchased the zircon water detectors to detect leaks in my kitchen faucet, but 2 out of 3 were DOA. on top of that, the one that worked just didn't seem that sensitive. i returned those and i ordered these instead and feel they are much better made and the sensors are much more sensitive, they will go off on just a bit of moisture. i also liked that you can pull out the sensor below and place the alert box somewhere dry. highly recommend, small investment to save you thousands of dollars in costly water damage repairs.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with regular water and even on a reverse osmosis water. The long cable is great for positioning it in tighter areas. I placed one near my reef tank, one under my kitchen sink and one in the kids bathroom...which already went off!
customer_reviews.author: **SG**

customer_reviews.title: It will let you know
customer_reviews.text: I installed 2 of the 3 included alarms in my utility room (basement) to monitor my softener and my furnace for leaks to protect my newly finished basement. The alarm is loud enough to hear from my main floor, and I'll replace the batteries once a year.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: These saved me from a big headache!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, there are limitations as mentioned in other posts regarding lack of battery indicator and that the unit must be upright. That said, I had purchased these alarms and placed them in strategic areas (hot water heater, washing machine, etc) likely to have water although we never had a previous issue with a water leak. Well, during a recent torrential sideway-rainstorm i was alerted at 3:00 a.m. to a leak coming in by the furnace vent. I was able to stop the leak immediately with no resulting damage instead of discovering what would have been a much bigger water problem. For me, this was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G.

customer_reviews.title: I need water frogs
customer_reviews.text: They don’t stand up and stay up too well. I had the frog that worked perfectly. I put this under the kitchen sink. Had a leak and did not buzz. I investigated and the damn thing had fallen over. Looking for more water frogs.
customer_reviews.author: Bocker

customer_reviews.title: All alarms tested out fine
customer_reviews.text: All alarms tested out fine. It's great that batteries are provided, though they are only "super heavy duty" and not (apparently) alkaline.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: These work great, very loud
customer_reviews.text: These work great, very loud. Unfortunately I got these too late the first time (had a massive water leak where the braided water line under my sink broke, caused a lot of damage-would have had significantly less damage if this would have been yelling at us from the water leak). However, now I look at these as very cheap insurance and have them anywhere there is a hard to reach water area (washing machine, dishwasher, behind the ice maker) the leads on these units are very helpful to reach.
customer_reviews.author: Bakit

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: These are so simple and loud enough to alert the neighbors in the high rise condo if I my unit has a water leak while I’m not there. I have one in the kitchen, bath, and HVAC closet.
customer_reviews.author: JCR

customer_reviews.title: REALLY WORKS AND IS VERY LOUD!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had my first alarm from water under the laundry-room sink today, a year after installing. Heard it upstairs at other end of house. Freaked out the cats! This alarm detects the merest spill of water. Excellent! Also have one under the water heater.
customer_reviews.author: Terpsichore

customer_reviews.title: Needs some improvement.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for the price but 2 things could be improved on. 1- the battery wires get caught in the door slide making it tough to replace the battery. 2 -The siren (which has a constant tone) would be much more effective if it was a warbler or intermittent unit.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: If alarm is not loud then change the included battery
customer_reviews.text: If the sound is not very loud change the battery that is included before returning. 2 of the 3 I got barely made a sound until I changed the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher George Hossfeld

customer_reviews.title: Worked. Alarmed when plastic pipe split.
customer_reviews.text: Blew a line under sink not more than a month after installing under sink. Worth every penny. Put storage bin lids under sinks then set alarm in lowest point. Protect wood and alarms quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff proud USA Legal Citizen

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these moisture water detectors after our air conditioner started leaking water onto the floor because of the drain clog. I put one behind the toilets in the upstairs bathrooms as well.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Garcia

customer_reviews.title: This will give you peace of mind #1 (see other review Zircon 63931)
customer_reviews.text: First Alert WA100-3 Alarm to provide and upright install (water heater, washer; both tight fit and toilets, under refrigerator) and ability to detach contact points set away from unit with 6' cord. Loud and feel a lot better that there is a detection unit in place. In addition, I installed Zircon 62931 under kitchen and bathroom sinks. This is being used in conjunction with a aluminum liner that was ordered via Moffitt. Recommend that you have a liner under sink to minimize damage to cabinet floor. The Zircon lies flat.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne N.

customer_reviews.title: a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: A few days after I put these in my basement, my hot water heater leaked, and THANK GOODNESS for these, I heard them go off outside, avoiding a HUGE problem!!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Vespe

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly. Worked the first night we used it and alerted us to a disaster of a water problem! So grateful for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy E. Guerriero

customer_reviews.title: Great water alarms!
customer_reviews.text: After finding a little leak in my water filter system under a sink (in brand new cabinets) I decided I needed some water alarms around the house. I have one sitting next to my old water heater in the basement, one under the kitchen sink, and one under another sink. These would be handy to have in so many different places...in rarely used guest bathrooms or basement bathrooms. Really, anywhere there is a pressurized water line that isn't monitored often. I like that these do not have the remote sensor to mess with. There are two "contacts" on the bottom of the unit that when bridged with even slight moisture, set off a loud alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Pedgoogl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and works well
customer_reviews.text: These work right out of the package, after you insert the battery. The battery is easy to put in. I tested all 3 to be safe and they worked perfectly. One note: Make sure to tuck the battery wires down one side to avoid blocking the battery door.
customer_reviews.author: JN

customer_reviews.title: Read this
customer_reviews.text: As with most sensors, the same blob water must come into contact with both contacts for the alarm to sound. Tested and working! I will be using this in the future to prevent plumbing and neighborly disasters.
customer_reviews.author: Some Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Better Than INSURANCE!
customer_reviews.text: I have these early warning systems under all my sinks after a dishwasher water leak ruined my downstairs family room while I was at home. There are two contacts on the bottom and if there is water it completes the circuit and the alarm sounds. I tested it by licking the back of my hand and placing one there. LOUD alarm. Recommended. I will always have these in my home. Basement, sinks, laundry room, anywhere flooding may occor.
customer_reviews.author: WSW

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive alarm, noise volume need to be louder.
customer_reviews.text: Great alarm picking up slightest moisture. The alarm sound is too soft to hear from the basement or distant corners of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Zhuldyz T.

customer_reviews.title: This is my second purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased one of these previously. I had a pipe leak under the sink in the middle of the night. The plastic tubing to the water filter blew at the connector. The alarm woke me right away. I had a little water damage but with the kitchen being completely on the other side of the house, the damage could have been worse. I purchase this pack of three because I installed 2 more and gifted the third to my brother. Easy to read instructions. Loud alarm, Easy to install as a package or as the remote feature up to 6 feet away. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L. Kellett Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad
customer_reviews.text: I already had a minor leak in my basement and this alarm kept the damage to a minimum. If you have a very large house or one that sound doesnt travel well in you might sleep through the alarm, and of course this alarm does you no good if you are not home. Bottom line, it does what it says it does, but if you have the money upgrade to one that alerts your phone. Thankfully I was home and I heard the alarm from my bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I had a leaky water heater so after the fact ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a leaky water heater so after the fact I bought these. They can be set directly on the floor or there is an included remote sensor. I also use them in my travel trailer in case an under sink fitting comes loose. A leak in a travel trailer can be very expensive due to the particle board floors.
customer_reviews.author: G. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea, Protect your house
customer_reviews.text: I have a drain higher than my floor in my basement so i rely on a laundry tray pump to discharge my laundry water. I used the detachable sensor and glued it to the top of the tray so in the event that the pump fails i can run don and shut down the machines before it runs over the edge. I also put one behind the washer in case of a hose burst and by the hot water heater, and boiler in case of a leak. Very loud! and they seem to be a quality product, a must have in a finished basement or one without a floor drain.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie 96

customer_reviews.title: Water damage saver
customer_reviews.text: These have seriously saved me some damage. After dealing with a couple pipe breaks in an old house I was looking for a solution. A water alarm is just like a smoke alarm and will emit when it feels the presence of water. So I place under sinks, refrigerator and toilets. It is very sensitive though so when cleaning it has gone off at times when spraying a cleaner near it or splashing water near it.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: These things really work
customer_reviews.text: I recommend putting these anywhere you might have a water leak, they really work and they go off with the slightest amount of water it doesn't have to be a gushing leak. We have them in our travel trailer and they have already saved us a lot of grief from a water leak, you have to velcro them to something so they don't fall over when traveling. I recommend placing a cloth under them that will cover a larger area, it will wick the water to the alarm just in case your leak doesn't run to where the alarm actually is. I think I've bought about 20 of them I love em so much.
customer_reviews.author: Myrtle the Turtle

customer_reviews.title: Lol what a sound. I was afraid I won't ...
customer_reviews.text: Lol what a sound. I was afraid I won't hear them. Yeah ok. When it went off i couldn't reach it fast enough to shut it up. It also has a really cool feature where the sensor has a wire so you can put the sensor in one place and the box in another. I think it's a foot or two long. To me it came really handy, one of the alarms was going in a place where I wouldn't have easy access to. So it was a saver to be able to mount the alarm itself in a reachable place
customer_reviews.author: Booomchik

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: Fortunately I haven't had a flooded basement to test them out yet, but I gave one to a friend who did and she was very grateful when it alerted her to the rising water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just works
customer_reviews.text: I received this pack of 3 water alarms, and installed one in my water cooler, and the other two under the condensate pans in my heat pumps. These units seem to be very sensitive to moisture, and provide peace of mind knowing that if I get a plugged drain line in my heat pump pans or a "leaker" bottle from my spring water vendor, I can be alerted and get to the problem before it floods my floor with gallons of water that would soak into my carpet and wood and cause damage. I just need to remember to change the 9V batteries once a year when I change the ones in my smoke alarms.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkie

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I put these in 3 areas of my basement. One was behind my washing machine. Good thing I put it there, because I discovered a leak that I didn't know I had. Sounds very loud.
customer_reviews.author: CJK

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not the best
customer_reviews.text: They work as advertised. I was looking at some Honeywell alarms and theirs had a wire that can detect moisture along the length of wire, which would be ideal. These work, but you have to be sure to get the leads close to the place where you'd expect a leak or water standing.
customer_reviews.author: Just another shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very sensitive to water: excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I am loving these and have put them in 14 places in my house. Two silver water sensors are on the bottom of the unit, and the 9 V battery fits neatly in the little designated compartment. I am preferring this brand to "the watchdog" brand because they seem MUCH more sensitive to water.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect for my basement
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for my basement. My basement flooded and I had no idea there was any water. :/ With these water alarm packs I feel more at ease in the fact I will hear the alarm when a little bit of water gets in my basement. I gave this a 4 star because I think they are a big expensive. I wish I got a pack of 6 for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Emitis

customer_reviews.title: We haven't had to use these yet, but they ...
customer_reviews.text: We haven't had to use these yet, but they tested well! I researched "smart" alarms but the opinions were too varied, so we'll continue to turn the water off when we travel and use these for peace of mind while residing in the home.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: good product very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: A previous review recommended to put a section of paper towel under the unit and it helps sound off any water invasion
customer_reviews.author: Charles Willis

customer_reviews.title: Great for piece of mind
customer_reviews.text: These devices have saved me once with a leak that developed under my kitchen sink. You can place the unit directly near potential water leak source or detach bottom and place sensor several feet away from sensor. A wire contained in the base of the unit allows sensor to be placed away from unit. I have one mounted on the side of my washing machine and have the sensor running under washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hilyard

customer_reviews.title: Loud, stable, and remote-capable, given the cable ...
customer_reviews.text: Loud, stable, and remote-capable, given the cable inside. I'm using these to tell me ahead of time that roots have clogged my main again by putting one up against the basement toilet, which is the first indicator. Sent one to Dad's house to prop up against his old water heater. Have one in reserve. Cheap piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Limits damage by early warning.
customer_reviews.text: Installed these under all sinks and washer and water heater. Early warning helped limit water damage in a small condo.
customer_reviews.author: Moonman

customer_reviews.title: Saved house from.flooding.
customer_reviews.text: Had it for six years, forgot about it, alarm went off today, saved us from a flooded house!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Begert

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: We put this inside a pot under the sink to catch a sporadically leaking drain pipe. It works well and is fairly simple - the sensor is just two terminals and the alarm sounds when there’s a connection between the two terminals. So if you’re planning a similar use case, I’d suggest putting the sensor in a plastic container instead of something conductive.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: A huge help when our humidifier unit was leaking
customer_reviews.text: The sound was loud enough that I heard a noise in the basement and was able to stop our humidifier from leaking more than a small amount on the basement floor. We ordered more since then.
customer_reviews.author: JMG Art

customer_reviews.title: Compared to the Honeywell RWD41 its capability is limited and may not be such a good price deal
customer_reviews.text: There is one sensor point with each unit. If the sensor is not positioned exactly where water will flood, it is no use until water reaches it, which could be too late. Compared to the Honeywell RWD41 its capability is limited and may not be such a good price deal! It is loud, however, if you are looking for something that will alert the neighborhood.....!
customer_reviews.author: etabri

customer_reviews.title: be sure to get the correct product
customer_reviews.text: Have water leak issues in my basement. These sensors work great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great item-9V battery for long life
customer_reviews.text: These work great-bought several, installed near washer/dryer, dishwasher and hot water heater. I was surprised how hard it was to find a simple water alarm. My brother-in-law had a dishwasher shut off float stick, flooded his kitchen and den while he slept, several thousand $$ and insurance claim as well as time to get repaired. This would have minimized the damage.
customer_reviews.author: Knife Guy

customer_reviews.title: Saved my Apartment!
customer_reviews.text: Saved my floor and apartment! 3am it goes off, sounds like a fire alarm. When I got to the room I couldn't even tell which alarm it was because so little water had spilled. Sure enough one aquarium is trickling water and a small puddle was starting to make its way around to the front. It was a horrible night, but would have been a much worse morning had I not bought these just a couple weeks before. I can't believe I ever had aquariums without one behind every tank.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with a name brand like First Alert
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with a name brand like First Alert. Easy to setup & use. Wished they came in a 4 pack. Great value for a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson Yuen

customer_reviews.title: Great product. We forgot we had place them about ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. We forgot we had place them about six months ago AFTER a dishwasher had malfunctioned and caused a mess. When one night some liquid soap was leaking from its container under the sink we were going nuts trying to find where the ear piercing sound was coming from. This time is was an easy cleanup. Definitely worth having.
customer_reviews.author: Customer Review

customer_reviews.title: It is better to learn of a leak as soon as it ...
customer_reviews.text: Saved our basement many many times! These alarms only work when water hits them. Put them near your hot water heater, under sinks and near laundry pipes. Any leak will be detected. This is a must have for home owners. It is better to learn of a leak as soon as it happens. However, be aware - they are VERY loud. They will get your attention!
customer_reviews.author: NABumb

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as it should.
customer_reviews.text: No problems, I set one up by the sump pump and came home several nonths later to the alarn blaring. Turned out the sump pump wasn't quite installed correctly. Fixed the issue and reset the sump pump/alarm. If only I could have a cheap smart sensor as well.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Pope

customer_reviews.title: Saved the day!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, detects even small amounts of water. Worked in my basement with a small leak during a big storm and with drip leak from a newly installed water filter. In both situations it alerted us to the leak before it did damage
customer_reviews.author: Mizbet

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Insurance
customer_reviews.text: These things are great. I have them all over the house (under sinks, dishwasher, washer, fridge, basement sump, water heater etc ). I check the batteries every two years and they still work but need replacement. They have saved me a few times. Only cons are In a few places i have to weight down the sensor ( I use plumbers putty for that) and the battery clip is the old type that can be difficult to get the 9 volt battery on an off.
customer_reviews.author: ejb

customer_reviews.title: Water leaking sensor
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Saved my basement when my sum pump failed..
customer_reviews.author: Ja

customer_reviews.title: These work very well.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for when you're worried about possible leaks in the basement, near the washer, etc. Just set them up so the bottom terminals get wet if water leaks.
customer_reviews.author: electriccafe

customer_reviews.title: 2-Year Update
customer_reviews.text: Still going strong with original 9v batteries. Just tested again at the 2-year mark and still works instantly when water touches both contacts. Effective for what it is designed to do and quite loud. Placed unit near water heater and furnace in basement as well as water main entry. Great product. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CC-REVIEWER

customer_reviews.title: Good gift ideas
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift. Shipped promptly. I'm considering some for my personal use.
customer_reviews.author: The Woodman

customer_reviews.title: Water alarm for dishwasher and kitchen plumbing.
customer_reviews.text: When dishwasher leaked and we were unaware of the leak, we had to remove wallboard and have it replaced. Hope this will warn us if this happens again. We tested the alarm and it is very loud even when it is placed against a damp sponge. The alarm is in the cabinet under the sink with the sensor taped to the floor to alert us when the plumbing or dishwasher leaks. Wish we had known about this before.
customer_reviews.author: Jeh.

customer_reviews.title: These units were easy to deploy
customer_reviews.text: These units were easy to deploy. I put one under my dishwasher and one beside my washing machine. You can mount them upright or on their backs (they have a removable sensor attached by a wire that snaps into place when used upright). I have not had any actual alarms (thank goodness), so I do not know how effective they are. I did test them prior to placement and the alarm is quite loud.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Powell

product_meta.title: First Alert WA100-3 Water Alarm for Leak Detection and Flood Alerts, 3-Pack
product_meta.description:
Help keep your valuable items safe from water damage with First Alert WA100-3 Water Alarms for Leak Detection and Flood Alerts. Ideal for basements, garages, laundry rooms, and bathrooms, these water detectors help you know the moment unwanted water appears in your home. Place one of the leak alarms at the bottom of a washing machine, water heater, or toilet, or in any room where there is fear of flooding. If a unit senses water, it will emit a loud 85-decibel alarm that will continue for up to 72 hours until silenced. Each water sensor is splash- and water-resistant and can be placed up to 6 feet away from its alarm unit. Each water alarm runs on a 9-volt battery and can operate in temperatures between 32 and 120 degrees Fahrenheit. This pack includes three water detectors and three 9-volt batteries.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
This 3 Pack First Alert Water Alarm Protects homes from water damage due to leaks, floods and seepage. Ideal uses: basements, garages, laundry rooms, bathrooms, hot tubs. Place near sump pump, washing machine, water heater, sinks, toilets. Water sensor attaches to bottom of unit or can extend 6 feet to remote location. Loud 85dB alarm sounds when unit senses water (lasts up to 72 hrs). Splash and water resistant
feature_bullets: Water alarm helps detect unwanted water
Great for early detection of leaking appliances or external flooding
Loud 85-decibel alarm designed to be heard easily
Sensor can be placed up to 6 feet away from alarm unit
Includes three water detectors and three 9-volt batteries

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars548 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
